newsitem.title: GERMANY: German police detain 31 neo-Nazis at checkpoints.
newsitem.headline: German police detain 31 neo-Nazis at checkpoints.

text.p: German police in the eastern state of Thuringia detained 31 right-wing extremists suspected to be on their way to banned rallies to commemorate the 10th anniversary of the death of Hitler's deputy, Rudolf Hess.
A police spokesman said 22 of the extremists had been detained at a checkpoint in the north of the state, which has imposed a blanket ban on gatherings connected with Hess's death.
The extremists were detained for inciting racial hatred and displaying sybols of anti-constitutional organisations.

Hess hanged himself with an electric cord in Berlin's Spandau prison on August 17, 1987, and the date has become a rallying point for the radical right in Germany and other European countries in recent years.

Last year German police detained 160 right-wing activists on the ninth anniversary, while hundreds of neo-Nazis battled with police in Sweden, Norway and Germany's neighbour Denmark, which permits such rallies.
Several German states have imposed blanket bans on Hess rallies this weekend and officials have said they believe many neo-Nazis may head for events in Denmark.
